text: Maksim Vladimirovich Tarasov (, born 2 December 1970 in Yaroslavl, Soviet Union) is a retired Russian pole vaulter. He is the Russian national record holder for pole vault, with 6.05, result achieved in 1996. ==Biography== He represented the USSR, the Unified Team, and later Russia. His personal best jump is 6.05 metres, which puts him fourth in the all-time performers list.Official All Time Top List - IAAF He was the surprise Gold medalist at the 1992 Summer Olympics, representing the Unified Team, over favourite Ukrainian teammate Sergey Bubka, who missed all the attempts at the final. He represented Russia at the 2000 Summer Olympics, winning a Bronze medal. A serious injury forced him to leave competition in 2001. == Achievements == {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing the |- |1988 |World Juniors |Sudbury, Canada |bgcolor="silver"|2nd |5.60 m |- |1991 |World Championships |Tokyo, Japan |bgcolor="cc9966"|3rd |5.85 m |- !colspan="6"|Representing the |- |1992 |Olympic Games |Barcelona, Spain |bgcolor="gold"|1st |5.80 m |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1993 |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |bgcolor="cc9966"|3rd |5.80 m |- |1995 |World Championships |Gothenburg, Sweden |bgcolor="silver"|2nd |5.86 m |- |1996 |IAAF Grand Prix Final |Milan, Italy |bgcolor="gold"|1st |5.90 m |- |rowspan=2|1997 |World Indoor Championships |Paris, France |bgcolor="cc9966"|3rd |5.80 m |- |World Championships |Athens, Greece |bgcolor="silver"|2nd |5.96 m |- |1998 |European Championships |Budapest, Hungary |bgcolor="gold"|1st |5.81 m |- |1999 |World Championships |Seville, Spain |bgcolor="gold"|1st |6.02 m CR |- |2000 |Olympic Games |Sydney, Australia |bgcolor="cc9966"|3rd |5.90 m |} ==See also== * 6 metres club ==References== ==External links== * Category:1970 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Yaroslavl Category:Russian male pole vaulters Category:Soviet male pole vaulters Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2000 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of the Unified Team Category:Olympic athletes of Russia Category:Olympic gold medalists for the Unified Team Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Russia Category:World Athletics Championships medalists Category:European Athletics Championships medalists Category:Medalists at the 2000 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic gold medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Olympic bronze medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Goodwill Games medalists in athletics Category:World Athletics Championships winners
